meanings.definition: To cause to be in a state of mewing or crying.
meanings.sent1: The kitten's loud enmew startled the dog.
meanings.sent2: She enmewed softly to comfort the upset child.
meanings.sent3: The enmewing cat demanded attention from its owner.
meanings.sent4: His enmewing voice echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The enmew of the baby bird caught the mother's attention.

meanings.sent1: The hungry kitten enmews for food.
meanings.sent2: She enmewed in delight upon seeing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The enmewing cat followed her around the house.
meanings.sent4: His enmewing echoed in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The enmew of the lost kitten tugged at her heartstrings.

meanings.sent1: The enmew of the kitten was adorable.
meanings.sent2: She heard the enmew of a lost cat outside.
meanings.sent3: The enmew of the baby woke her up at night.
meanings.sent4: His enmew could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The enmew of the puppy was heartwarming.
